{{infobox character | people=[[Númenóreans|Númenórean]] | name=Orchaldor | image= | caption= | pronun= | othernames= | titles= | position= | location=[[Númenor]] | affiliation= | language= | birth=Before {{SA|799}} | birthlocation=Númenor | rule= | death= | deathlocation= | age= | notablefor= | house=descended from the [[House of Hador]] | parentage=[[Hatholdir]] | siblings= | spouse=[[Ailinel]] | children=[[Soronto]] | gender=Male | height= | hair= | eyes= | clothing= | weapons= | steed= }} '''Orchaldor''', the son of [[Hatholdir]], was descended from the [[House of Hador]]. He was a close friend of [[Tar-Meneldur]] and married his elder daughter, [[Ailinel]]. The son of Orchaldor and Ailinel was [[Soronto]], who desired the kingship. When [[Tar-Aldarion]] created a new [[Law of Succession in Númenor]], which allowed his daughter [[Tar-Ancalimë|Ancalimë]] to receive the [[Sceptre of Númenor|Sceptre]], the possibility existed that if she refused to rule, died childless, or remained unwed beyond a certain time limit, then Soronto would have become King. As it happened, none of these possibilities came to pass and Tar-Ancalimë served as Númenor's first Ruling Queen.{{UT|Wife}} ==Etymology== ''Orchaldor'' is a [[Sindarin]] name. Its meaning is not glossed, but Paul Strack suggests it means "Tall Lord" and is a compound of ''orchal'' ("tall") and ''-dor'' ("lord").{{webcite|author=Paul Strack|articleurl=https://www.eldamo.org/content/words/word-4245825211.html|articlename=S.
